docs.snippet: Britain's FTSE 100 blue-chip index hit fresh record highs on Tuesday, boosted by gains among retailers, while a rally in mining stocks more than offset weaker financials, helping European shares end slightly in positive territory....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's FTSE 100 blue-chip index hit fresh record highs on Tuesday, boosted by gains among retailers, while a rally in mining stocks more than offset weaker financials, helping European shares end slightly in positive territory.

headline.main: FTSE Hits New Record as Miners Help European Shares Inch Up
headline.print_headline: FTSE Hits New Record as Miners Help European Shares Inch Up

docs.snippet: Israeli soldiers shot dead a Palestinian who the military said tried to attack them with a knife during a raid on Tuesday to detain suspected militants in a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank....
docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli soldiers shot dead a Palestinian who the military said tried to attack them with a knife during a raid on Tuesday to detain suspected militants in a refugee camp in the occupied West Bank.

headline.main: Israeli Troops Kill Knife-Wielding Palestinian in West Bank Raid: Military
headline.print_headline: Israeli Troops Kill Knife-Wielding Palestinian in West Bank Raid: Military

docs.snippet: Republicans will work on unraveling and replacing the health care law at the same time, House Speaker Paul Ryan said Tuesday as GOP leaders struggled to align their zeal to rapidly erase one of President Barack Obama's proudest achievements with C...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans will work on unraveling and replacing the health care law at the same time, House Speaker Paul Ryan said Tuesday as GOP leaders struggled to align their zeal to rapidly erase one of President Barack Obama's proudest achievements with Congress' legislative and political pitfalls.

headline.main: Ryan: GOP Will Work on Repealing, Replacing Health Law
headline.print_headline: Ryan: GOP Will Work on Repealing, Replacing Health Law

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama bid farewell to the nation Tuesday in an emotional speech that sought to comfort a country on edge over rapid economic changes, persistent security threats and the election of Donald Trump....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama bid farewell to the nation Tuesday in an emotional speech that sought to comfort a country on edge over rapid economic changes, persistent security threats and the election of Donald Trump.

headline.main: 'Yes We Did' _ Obama Bids Farewell in Nostalgic Last Speech
headline.print_headline: 'Yes We Did' _ Obama Bids Farewell in Nostalgic Last Speech

docs.snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's display panel subsidiary plans to invest another 3 trillion won ($2.51 billion) in Vietnam to boost capacity, South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported on Tuesday, citing unnamed sources....

headline.main: Samsung Display Plans to Invest Another $2.5 Billion in Vietnam: Yonhap
headline.print_headline: Samsung Display Plans to Invest Another $2.5 Billion in Vietnam: Yonhap

docs.snippet: "You're OK, you're OK," Lola Webber, a campaign manager with the Humane Society International (HSI), whispers to a lab-mix puppy, cradling her in a jacket as dozens of dogs bark in nearby cages....

docs.snippet: Oil edged up on Wednesday, lifted by reports of Saudi supply cuts to Asia, but prices were prevented from rising further over a lack of detail of these reductions and because of signs of rising supplies from other producers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oil edged up on Wednesday, lifted by reports of Saudi supply cuts to Asia, but prices were prevented from rising further over a lack of detail of these reductions and because of signs of rising supplies from other producers.

headline.main: Oil Prices Edge Up on Reports of Saudi Supply Cuts, but Details Murky
headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Edge Up on Reports of Saudi Supply Cuts, but Details Murky

docs.snippet: Clemson finished atop The Associated Press College football poll Tuesday, knocking Alabama from the spot it held all season, and Southern California became the first team to finish as high as No. 3 with three losses....
